trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <codeph>dblook</codeph> utility is a Data Definition Language (DDL) generation utility.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <codeph>dblook</codeph> utility is a Data Definition Language (DDL) generation utility.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <codeph>dblook</codeph> utility is a Data Definition Language (DDL) generation utility.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>dblook</codeph> utility is a simple utility that dumps all or parts of the DDL of a user-specified database to either a console or a file. The generated DDL can then be used for such things as recreating all or parts of a database, viewing a subset of the objects in a database (for example, those objects that pertain to specific tables and schemas), or documenting the schema of a database.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>dblook</codeph> utility is a simple utility that dumps all or parts of the DDL of a user-specified database to either a console or a file.

The generated DDL can then be used for such things as recreating all or parts of a database, viewing a subset of the objects in a database (for example, those objects that pertain to specific tables and schemas), or documenting the schema of a database.

target.mrk: The <codeph>dblook</codeph> utility is a simple utility that dumps all or parts of the DDL of a user-specified database to either a console or a file.

The generated DDL can then be used for such things as recreating all or parts of a database, viewing a subset of the objects in a database (for example, those objects that pertain to specific tables and schemas), or documenting the schema of a database.
